intro: Rorippa pyrenaica subsp. thracica, commonly known as the Thrace watercress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. It typically features small, glossy, ovate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in moist, calcareous environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the Rorippa genus.
